text:
Hey just a heads up <@U026PLK4S> <@U0260V1BX> or whoever is in charge of the global spec doc: I have some content I’ve assembled for baseline, global motion design parameters that should make it’s way into the spec doc at some point. It’s for post-launch reference so not a huge rush. I may also have extra info to provide later but this is the basics that need to make their way in.

Content is in the “Universal Easing” tab. Only content in bold, black should be included. Let me know if I can clarify/format anything differently.
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LLAng1a5gfnAVsSZQvxAoAuLk0zQwwgU5leelQemkXc/edit?usp=sharing>

(cc: <@U026103R3> )

Thanks Trent, maybe you and Matt can connect when we’re back next week (Tues) to chat about this. I’d be hesitant to distract the developers with an updated global spec doc at this point unless they are changes needed for launch. So I wonder if we hold off on adding to the doc for a bit, or create a post launch version and keep it on for when we get there.

I’ve posed a few high level questions to the devs to get their take on it. Some things are definitely not going to be implemented for launch, but this info includes basic timing durations as well, which may be used for launch (maybe just for Android and not iOS? I really don’t know and don’t want to grill them anymore with their current workload). Def open to a post-launch doc if that’s where this will fit best.

Thanks for the context Trent and appreciate trying to minimize the questions to keep them focused. We may want to wait until visual QA to decide honestly. I think we should plan for post launch until we find out otherwise - aka we get a question asking for this data or I get ahead of it and find out if we can do for post launch.

Cool cool. The work is done with it so it’s just a matter of finding a good home for it to keep it from dying in vain :) I think it will come in most handy when implementing all these motion studies we’ve decided on for post launch with home screen/badges/summary drawer etc.
Makes sense - and yes, let’s def get it documented so it doesn’t get lost. Can you help us remember to connect on this mid next week?
I’ll make a note as well
